page.title: 16Wildlife in Emborough
page.content: In the peace and quiet of Crocks Bottom roe deer live out their lives while pheasants call and squirrels jump between the trees. The buzzard circles far overhead while voles, field mice, weasels and stoats scurry amongst the undergrowth. Badgers wander the countryside at night along with their spikey neighbours the hedgehogs, while bats, dark shapes against the night sky, go foraging. The owl goes about his errie business. The fox can be seen making his way through the hedges and across fields startling rabbits and birds as he goes. During the day magpies chatter as they search for food for their fledglings and blackbirds, robins, finches and watails flit between the hederows feeding on the berries of autumnal abundance.
